hero.heading: Meet the warriors of
hero.title: The Blue Label Project
hero.subtitle: Bringing audiences face-to-face with wounded combat veterans who share their personal journey of injury, recovery, and renewal.

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are
description: We are a group of people who believe in the power of storytelling as a healing and unifying force and as a source of authentic knowledge.
We bring presentations about real-life experiences of wounded veterans from Israel's wars.
Each talk is built from real life experiences, combining inspiration with practical insights into resilience and human strength.
This is the continuation of a highly successful project already happening within Israel, and now there's an exceptional opportunity for international audiences to experience it as well.

professionalTraining.title: Professional Training
professionalTraining.description: All our speakers are fluent in both Hebrew and English, with professional training in public speaking and presentation skills.

professionalTeam.title: Professional Team
professionalTeam.description: Every speaker in the project has support from professional coaches who prepare speakers for all events.

workshops.title: Workshops
workshops.description: You can also book professional storytelling workshops delivered by the project's coaches, including workshops on improving message delivery and storytelling techniques.

increaseInWoundedVeterans.title: Increase in Wounded Veterans
increaseInWoundedVeterans.description: Following the war, the number of wounded continues to rise. Alongside medical and psychological support, one of the most effective tools for rehabilitation is sharing personal stories on stage. Today, there is an urgent need to create more opportunities for exposure.

strengtheningIdentity.title: Strengthening Identity and Unity
strengtheningIdentity.description: In a time of national and cultural confusion, these stories bring a sense of connection, pride, and belonging. They create unity within communities in Israel and abroad.

healingThroughPurpose.title: Healing Through Purpose
healingThroughPurpose.description: The lectures provide veterans with a renewed sense of capability and meaning. Even if they cannot return to their former professions, they can stand before an audience, inspire others, and feel valuable again.

highDemand.title: High Demand for Communication Skills
highDemand.description: Communities are eager for tools in self-expression and advocacy. The addition of our official speaker coach's workshop gives audiences not only the chance to listen but also to learn how to share their own voices and stories effectively.

flexibleFormat.title: Flexible Format
flexibleFormat.description: Tailored talks ranging from 10 to 60 minutes, depending on your needs.

authenticImpact.title: Authentic Impact
authenticImpact.description: Powerful, authentic content that touches hearts and minds with honest dialogue on courage, choice, community, and hope.

bilingualAccessibility.title: Bilingual Accessibility
bilingualAccessibility.description: Talks available in Hebrew and English, tailored to your audience and organizational values.

workshopAddition.title: Workshop Addition
workshopAddition.description: New option: Add an exclusive storytelling workshop with our official speaker coach, providing practical tools in the art of communication.

whyInvite.title: Why Invite Us
whyInvite.point1: First-hand inspiration - not stories about but stories from.
whyInvite.point2: Tailored content to your audience and organizational values.
whyInvite.point3: Lasting impact - an event that sparks meaningful dialogue and strengthens community bonds.

yaelManShahar.name: Yael Man Shahar
yaelManShahar.bio: Yael leads our speaker coaching program, personally preparing each veteran for their presentations. With extensive experience in communication training, she ensures every speaker delivers their story with maximum impact and authenticity. Yael also conducts exclusive storytelling workshops for organizations seeking to enhance their own communication skills.

noamFriedman.name: Noam Friedman
noamFriedman.bio: Noam coordinates all aspects of speaker engagements, working closely with organizations to understand their specific needs and matching them with the most appropriate speakers. He ensures seamless execution of every event, from initial planning to post-event follow-up.

ourSpeakers.title: Our Speakers
ourSpeakers.subtitle: Meet some of our inspiring speakers and their powerful talks

noamFriedman.name: Noam Friedman
noamFriedman.description: One morning, Noam's life turned upside down – from familiar routine into total chaos. Out of the darkness, he discovered small sparks of light that grew into a flame of hope. In this deeply personal talk, he shares how he transformed brokenness into meaning, proving that even in the darkest times, it is possible to reignite the light within.

nitzanLevy.name: Nitzan Levy
nitzanLevy.talkTitle: Falling and Rising, Again and Again
nitzanLevy.description: A combat officer in the armored corps, Nitzan was wounded during Operation Iron Swords and thrown into a grueling journey of rehabilitation. Each fall became a foundation for growth, each rise a source of strength. In this heartfelt talk, he shares his struggle with PTSD, the power of community, and the surprising discovery that letting go of control can open the door to a fuller life.

simonWasserman.name: Simon Wasserman
simonWasserman.description: A life of surfing and adventure suddenly turned into an inner storm he never knew existed. In midlife, Simon discovered that his lifelong struggles were rooted in hidden trauma. What followed was a journey of healing and growth, through which he returned to being a present and loving father. In this inspiring talk, he reveals how to navigate the eye of the emotional storm and discover that even in the darkest places, there is light.

avishaiShoshani.name: Avishai Shoshani
avishaiShoshani.talkTitle: It's Going to Be Long and Hard
avishaiShoshani.description: In his 50s, Avishai wasn't required to fight – yet he chose to join the reserves during Operation Iron Swords. Just before entering battle, he heard the words: "It's going to be long and hard." Shortly after, he was wounded, and that phrase became his anchor through rehabilitation. In this moving talk, he shows how a single sentence can become a source of resilience for anyone facing mental or emotional challenges.

elioorDor.name: Elioor Dor
elioorDor.description: Battles and injuries repeated themselves again and again, yet Elioor refused to break. The belief that "Nothing can hurt me" carried him even when trauma surfaced later on. From the depths of pain, he found new ways to rebuild himself, both physically and emotionally. In this honest talk, he reveals how even the hardest fall can become the starting point for growth.

odedMiraz.name: Oded Miraz
odedMiraz.description: Behind a calm and collected appearance, Oded carries an invisible wound – post-trauma from the battle of Beaufort. For years he hid it, moving forward as if nothing had happened, until he realized the real battle was inside. In this intimate talk, he shares his path to acknowledgment and healing, showing how even unseen wounds need light in order to recover.

scheduleMeeting.title: Schedule Your Discovery Meeting
scheduleMeeting.description: Ready to bring these powerful stories to your community? Let's start with a brief introductory meeting where we'll understand your needs and match you with the perfect speakers for your event.
scheduleMeeting.practicalDetails: Practical Details: Duration 10-60 minutes | Languages: Hebrew & English | Costs adjusted according to event size, length, and format
